meanings.definition: To reconsider or rethink something in a new way.
meanings.sent1: She reconceptualized her approach to solving the math problem.
meanings.sent2: The artist reconceptualized the design of the building to make it more modern.
meanings.sent3: After hours of confusion, she finally reconceptualized the math problem and solved it with ease.
meanings.sent4: His perspective on the issue was reconceptualized when he heard the opposing argument.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reconceptualized the lesson by using real-life examples to help the students understand better.

meanings.definition: To revise or change the conceptualization of something.
meanings.sent1: They reconceptualized the marketing strategy to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: The company reconceptualized their product to meet the changing market demands.
meanings.sent3: The team reconceptualized the project plan after realizing they had overlooked a crucial detail.
meanings.sent4: Her dream of becoming a doctor was reconceptualized when she discovered her passion for teaching.
meanings.sent5: The architect reconceptualized the building's layout to maximize natural light and space.
